title: “Iron Dome” Becomes “Golden Dome”
summary: President Trump’s directive to build an “Iron Dome for America” is getting a name change. Instead of Iron Dome, it now is Golden Dome. The purpose is the same — […]

title: Blue Origin launches tenth New Shepard suborbital human spaceflight
summary:
Blue Origin conducted the tenth crewed flight of its New Shepard suborbital vehicle Feb. 25, carrying six people, one of whom was at least semi-anonymous.
The post Blue Origin launches tenth New Shepard suborbital human spaceflight appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Wargaming the Unknown: The Space Force’s challenge in preparing for a war no one has fought
summary:
Col. Lincoln Bonner said simulating potential adversary actions in space is "absolutely essential" given the lack of historical conflicts to study.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch Intuitive Machines’ Moon lander on Falcon 9 rocket from the Kennedy Space Center
summary: The launch is a rideshare mission with secondary payloads from NASA’s Jet Propulsion Lab, AstroForge and Epic Aerospace. Liftoff is set for no earlier than Wednesday, Feb. 26, at 7:16 p.m. EST (0016 UTC).

title: Eutelsat hails pioneering 5G test over LEO
summary:
Amid growing efforts to bridge satellites and mobile networks, Eutelsat said it has successfully employed its OneWeb constellation to connect a broadband terminal with a core 5G network using next-gen smartphone protocols.
The post Eutelsat hails pioneering 5G test over LEO appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Diamonds from NASA’s X-59
summary: NASA’s X-59 quiet supersonic research aircraft took another successful step toward flight with the conclusion of a series of engine performance tests. During maximum afterburner testing, a test demonstrating the engine’s ability to generate the thrust required for supersonic flight, the aircraft showed off a phenomenon known as Mach diamonds, seen in this image from […]

title: NASA’s Europa Clipper Uses Mars to Go the Distance
summary: The orbiter bound for Jupiter’s moon Europa will investigate whether the moon is habitable, but it first will get the help of Mars’ gravitational force to get to deep space. On March 1, NASA’s Europa Clipper will streak just 550 miles (884 kilometers) above the surface of Mars for what’s known as a gravity assist […]
